column1:
Worry less about being labeled weak. Worry more about getting it right.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
How can we in good conscience justify war before we have tested a diplomatic agreement that achieves our objectives?" —President Obama __END__
“The choice we face is ultimately between diplomacy or some sort of war.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
“Walk away from this agreement and you will get a better deal—for Iran.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
“Those who say we can walk away from this deal and maintain sanctions are selling a fantasy.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
We will continue to have sanctions in place on Iran's support for terrorism and violation of human rights.—President Obama #IranDeal __END__
“There is no scenario where sanctions relief turns Iran into the region's dominate power.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
“An argument against sanctions relief is effectively an argument against any diplomatic solution.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
Without this deal, the scenarios that critics warn about happening in 15 years could happen six months from now. —President Obama __END__
The bottom line is, if Iran cheats, we can catch them—and we will. —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
“This deal is not just the best choice among alternatives—this is the strongest non-proliferation agreement ever.” —President Obama __END__
“If Iran violates the agreement over the next decade all of the sanctions can snap back in to place.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__
Iran has powerful incentives to keep its commitments. —President Obama #IranDeal __END__

This deal shuts off the type of covert program Iran has pursued in the past.” —President Obama #IranDeal __END__

column2: we reached a comprehensive plan of action that meets our objectives." —President Obama #IranDeal __END__

I have also made clear my preference for a peaceful diplomatic resolution of the issue. —President Obama #IranDeal __END__

If we keep taking steps toward a more perfect union ... America will move forward. There's nothing we can't do. —President Obama __END__
We cannot ignore the problems that we have, but we can't stop running the race. —President Obama __END__
We are not perfect, but we have the capacity to be more perfect—mile after mile, step after step. —President Obama __END__
Justice and redemption go hand in hand. —President Obama __END__
Justice is living up to the common creed that I am my brother's keeper and I am my sister's keeper. —President Obama __END__
Justice is making sure that every young person knows that they are special and their lives matter. —President Obama __END__
Justice is not only the absence of oppression—it is the presence of opportunity. —President Obama __END__
Let's reward prisoners with reduced sentences if they complete programs that make them less likely to repeat an offense. —President Obama __END__
I've asked my Attorney General to start a review of the overuse of solitary confinement in our federal prisons. —President Obama __END__
We should not tolerate conditions in prison that have no place in any civilized country. —President Obama __END__
On Thursday, I will be the first sitting president to visit a federal prison. —President Obama __END__
We should pass a sentencing reform bill through congress this year. —President Obama __END__
For nonviolent drug crimes, we need to lower long mandatory minimum sentences—or get rid of them entirely. —President Obama __END__
Don't just tag them as future criminals. Reach out to them as future citizens. —President Obama __END__
We have to restore trust between our police and some of the communities where they serve. —President Obama __END__
We gotta make sure boys and girls in those communities are loved and cherished and nurtured and invested in. —President Obama __END__
What doesn't make sense is treating entire neighborhoods as danger zones. —President Obama __END__
We recognize that every child deserves opportunity. Not just some. Not just our own. —President Obama __END__
One study found that for every dollar we invest in Pre-K, we save at least twice that in reduced crime. —President Obama __END__
If we make investments early in our children, we will reduce the need to incarcerate those kids. —President Obama __END__
I believe crime is like any other epidemic—we need to stop it before it starts. —President Obama __END__
For the first time in 40 years, America's crime rate and incarceration rate went down at the same time. —President Obama __END__
This is a cause that is bringing people in both houses of Congress together. —President Obama __END__
Mass incarceration makes our country worse off—and we need to do something about it. —President Obama __END__
Our criminal justice system isn't as smart as it should be. —President Obama __END__
Our nation is being robbed of men and women who could be workers and taxpayers. —President Obama __END__
Around one million fathers are behind bars. Around one in nine African-American kids has a parent in prison. —President Obama __END__
African Americans are more likely to be arrested. They are more likely to be sentenced to more time for the same crime. —President Obama __END__
A growing body of research shows that people of color are more likely to be frisked, stopped, questioned, detained. —President Obama __END__
African Americans and Latinos make up 30 percent of our population. They make up 60 percent of our inmates. —President Obama __END__
Roughly one-third of the Justice Department's budget now goes toward incarceration. —President Obama __END__
For $80 billion we could double the salary of every high school teacher in America. —President Obama __END__
Every year, we spend $80 billion to keep those folks incarcerated. —President Obama __END__
In far too many cases the punishment does not fit the crime. —President Obama __END__
Over the last few decades, we've locked up more and more nonviolent drug offenders for longer than ever before. —President Obama __END__
If we're going to deal with this problem, and the inequities involved, we're going to have to speak honestly. —President Obama __END__
Our prison population has doubled in the last two decades alone. —President Obama __END__
In 1980, there were 500,000 people behind bars in America ... Today, there are 2.2 million. —President Obama __END__
The United States is home to 5 percent of the world's population, but 25 percent of the world's prisoners. —President Obama __END__
In too many cases our criminal justice system becomes a pipeline from underfunded schools to overcrowded jails. —President Obama __END__
There is a long history of inequity in the criminal justice system in America. —President Obama __END__
We can't be satisfied—are not satisfied—until the opportunity gap is closed for everybody in America. —President Obama #NAACP106 __END__
Health care is not a privilege for the few, but a right for all of us. —President Obama __END__
We made progress, but our work is not done. —President Obama #NAACP106 __END__
I would not be here and so many others would not be here without the NAACP. —President Obama __END__
Let's get something out of the way up front: I am not singing today. —President Obama __END__

column1: We honor those who walked so we could run. We must run so our children soar. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
What a glorious task we are given, to continually try to improve this great nation of ours. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
We respect the past, but we don’t pine for the past. We don’t fear the future. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
We know America is what we make of it. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
We can make sure every person willing to work has the dignity of a job, and a fair wage, and a real voice. —President Obama #Selma50 __END__
With effort, we can roll back poverty and the roadblocks to opportunity. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
This is work for all Americans, and not just some. Not just whites. Not just blacks. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
Selma teaches us, too, that action requires that we shed our cynicism. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
If Selma taught us anything, it’s that our work is never done. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
Young people can draw strength from this place, where the powerless could change the world’s greatest power. —President Obama #Selma50 __END__
That’s what this movement was all about—one leg in our long journey toward freedom. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
What greater form of patriotism is there than the belief that America is not yet finished. —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
What could be more American than what happened in this place? —President Obama #Selma50 #MarchOn __END__
They proved that nonviolent change is possible. That love and hope can conquer hate. —President Obama #Selma50 __END__
What enormous faith these men and women had—faith in God, but also faith in America. —President Obama #Selma50 __END__
It was not a clash of armies, but a clash of wills; a contest to determine the true meaning of America. —President Obama #Selma50 __END__
There are places and moments in America where this nation’s destiny has been decided ... Selma is such a place. —President Obama #MarchOn __END__
